resources.string: Welcome to the official cycle management application of CHRIST (Deemed to be University). This app is used for the efficient management of cycles at the Kengeri Campus and aims to increase the accountability on the part of the student community, while also making it easier for the management to track and maintain cycles within the premises.
Designed and Developed by the Student Council of the Faculty of Engineering, CHRIST (Deemed to be University).
Press back one more time to exit
Please enter the email address with which you were registered. The password reset link will be sent to you via email.
Please enter your registered email address.
Your email is not registered with us.

The status refers to whether a cycle is in-use by a student or is parked at one of the designated locations. The status must only be changed after the cycle has been thoroughly inspected, and the student details must be noted in the complaint section in case of any damage.
Use the below form to indicate which parts of the cycle need to be repaired. Enabling any of the buttons will indicate that the cycle is in unusable condition, requiring repair.
Decommissioning a cycle will cause it to be virtually removed from the list of cycles. You will not be able to assign a decommissioned cycle.
Are you sure you want to add a new cycle?
Cannot proceed without an internet connection.
We hope to see you again soon! If you are experiencing any issues with the app, please do not hesitate to inform the Student Council.
Are you sure you want to sign out of the application? You can sign back in at any time.
